Bash("/c/Program Files/GitHub CLI/gh.exe" issue create --title "Rebrand from AcciLink to MedNexus" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Overview
Rebrand the entire platform from **AcciLink** to **MedNexus** across all files, components, and documentation.

## Name Rationale
**MedNexus** = Medical + Nexus (connection point)
- Modern, professional sound
- Clear medical industry focus
- "Nexus" conveys the core function: connecting attorneys and medical experts
- Memorable and brandable
- Tech-forward feel

## Scope of Changes

### Text Replacements (19+ files)
Replace all instances of "AcciLink" with "MedNexus":

#### Components (2 files):
1. `client/components/Header.tsx` - Logo text, meta tags
2. `client/components/Footer.tsx` - Company name, copyright

#### Pages (9 files):
3. `client/pages/Index.tsx` - Hero section, meta tags, multiple mentions
4. `client/pages/About.tsx` - Company story, mission section, multiple mentions
5. `client/pages/Features.tsx` - Feature descriptions, section headings
6. `client/pages/Pricing.tsx` - Trust signals, pricing descriptions
7. `client/pages/Contact.tsx` - Company info, address, email
8. `client/pages/Login.tsx` - Page title, branding
9. `client/pages/Signup.tsx` - Page title, trust signals
10. `client/pages/Dashboard.tsx` - Welcome message, branding
11. `client/pages/NotFound.tsx` - Brand name reference (if any)

#### Documentation (3 files):
12. `README.md` - Title, description, features, all references
13. `package.json` - Name, description fields
14. `index.html` - Title tag, meta description

#### Configuration (2 files):
15. `vite.config.ts` - Comments or config (if any)
16. `tailwind.config.ts` - Comments (if any)

#### Assets & Metadata:
17. Favicon metadata in `index.html`
18. Any brand references in CSS comments

### Email & Contact Info Updates

**Current Contact Info:**
- Email: support@accilink.com
- Address: 123 Medical Plaza, Suite 500, San Francisco, CA 94105
- Phone: (555) 123-4567

**New Contact Info:**
- Email: support@mednexus.com
- Address: (keep same for now)
- Phone: (keep same for now)

### CSS/Design System Comments

Update any brand-related comments in:
- `client/global.css` - Brand color comments
- `tailwind.config.ts` - Brand color comments
- `README.md` - Design system section

### Meta Tags & SEO

Update all meta tags and descriptions:
- Page titles: "MedNexus - [Page Name]"
- Meta descriptions: Replace "AcciLink" with "MedNexus"
- Open Graph tags (if present)
- Twitter card tags (if present)

## Implementation Checklist

### Phase 1: Core Brand Files
- [ ] `client/components/Header.tsx` - Logo and navigation
- [ ] `client/components/Footer.tsx` - Footer branding and copyright
- [ ] `index.html` - Page title and meta tags

### Phase 2: Public Pages
- [ ] `client/pages/Index.tsx` - Homepage hero and content
- [ ] `client/pages/About.tsx` - Company story and mission
- [ ] `client/pages/Features.tsx` - Feature descriptions
- [ ] `client/pages/Pricing.tsx` - Pricing page content
- [ ] `client/pages/Contact.tsx` - Contact info and email

### Phase 3: Authentication Pages
- [ ] `client/pages/Login.tsx` - Login page branding
- [ ] `client/pages/Signup.tsx` - Signup page branding
- [ ] `client/pages/Dashboard.tsx` - Dashboard welcome

### Phase 4: Documentation
- [ ] `README.md` - Full documentation update
- [ ] `package.json` - Package metadata

### Phase 5: Design System Comments
- [ ] `client/global.css` - CSS comments
- [ ] `tailwind.config.ts` - Config comments
- [ ] `README.md` - Design system documentation

### Phase 6: Quality Assurance
- [ ] Search entire codebase for remaining "AcciLink" references
- [ ] Test all pages in browser
- [ ] Verify meta tags in browser inspector
- [ ] Check console for any hardcoded references
- [ ] Verify copyright year and company name in footer

## Search & Replace Strategy

### Case-Sensitive Replacements:
- "AcciLink" â†’ "MedNexus"
- "accilink" â†’ "mednexus"
- "ACCILINK" â†’ "MEDNEXUS"
- "accilink.com" â†’ "mednexus.com"

### Files to Search:
```bash
# Search all TypeScript/TSX files
grep -r "AcciLink" client/ server/ shared/

# Search all config files
grep -r "AcciLink" *.json *.ts *.html *.md *.css
```

## Expected File Changes

**Estimated:**
- 15-20 files modified
- 100+ text replacements
- 1 email domain change
- Multiple meta tag updates

## Testing Checklist

After implementation:
- [ ] Homepage displays "MedNexus" in header
- [ ] Footer copyright shows "MedNexus"
- [ ] Browser tab title shows "MedNexus"
- [ ] About page company story references "MedNexus"
- [ ] Contact page shows support@mednexus.com
- [ ] All trust signals updated (e.g., "Trusted by 500+ law firms on MedNexus")
- [ ] Signup/Login pages show correct branding
- [ ] Dashboard welcome message shows "MedNexus"
- [ ] No console errors
- [ ] No remaining "AcciLink" references found in search

## SEO Considerations

**Positive Impacts:**
- Clearer medical industry positioning
- More memorable brand name
- Better keyword association (Med + Nexus)

**Neutral Changes:**
- Brand recognition resets (expected for rebrand)
- Domain authority stays with new domain

## Branch
`feature/rebrand-to-mednexus`

## Type
Branding update / Refactor

## Priority
High

## Related
- Design system (colors remain the same)
- Contact information
- Meta tags and SEO
EOF

Bash("/c/Program Files/GitHub CLI/gh.exe" issue create --title "Upgrade homepage images with professional medical-legal photography" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Overview
Replace current Pexels images with more professional, contextually appropriate photography that better represents the medical-legal coordination platform and builds trust with attorneys and medical providers.

## Current Images Analysis

### Image 1: Hero Section (Right Side)
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/8112172/pexels-photo-8112172.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Professional handshake between attorneys and medical providers"
- **Issue:** Generic business handshake, doesn''t convey medical-legal coordination
- **Needs:** More specific to legal + medical partnership

### Image 2: Step 1 - Set Up Profile
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/267482/pexels-photo-267482.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Create user profile setup"
- **Issue:** Open laptop with coffee - too generic, doesn''t convey professional setup
- **Needs:** Professional workspace or modern interface/dashboard

### Image 3: Step 2 - Find the Right Specialist
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/4792732/pexels-photo-4792732.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Search and connect with providers"
- **Issue:** Not clear what it represents
- **Needs:** Search/discovery concept, possibly medical directory or provider search

### Image 4: Step 3 - Coordinate & Close Cases
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/6809657/pexels-photo-6809657.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Coordinate care and appointments"
- **Issue:** Doesn''t clearly show coordination or case management
- **Needs:** Collaboration, scheduling, or case coordination visual

### Image 5: For Attorneys Section
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/6077797/pexels-photo-6077797.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Law office with justice scales and attorney workspace"
- **Issue:** Generic law office, doesn''t show medical expertise connection
- **Needs:** Attorney working with medical records/reports or consulting

### Image 6: For Providers Section
**Current:** https://images.pexels.com/photos/6129037/pexels-photo-6129037.jpeg
- **Alt text:** "Medical provider in healthcare workspace with modern technology"
- **Issue:** Generic healthcare setting
- **Needs:** Provider reviewing case files or collaborating with legal team

## Recommended New Images

### Option 1: Use Unsplash (Free, High-Quality)
**Search terms:**
- "legal medical collaboration"
- "attorney consultation"
- "medical professional consultation"
- "healthcare technology"
- "case management"
- "professional handshake medical legal"

**Unsplash Collections to Explore:**
- Healthcare: https://unsplash.com/s/photos/healthcare-professional
- Legal: https://unsplash.com/s/photos/attorney
- Business collaboration: https://unsplash.com/s/photos/professional-meeting
- Technology: https://unsplash.com/s/photos/dashboard

### Option 2: Use Stock Photography Services
**Recommended platforms:**
- **Unsplash** (Free) - High quality, professional
- **Pexels** (Current) - Free but need better selection
- **Pixabay** (Free) - Alternative free option
- **iStock** (Paid) - More specific medical-legal images

### Recommended Specific Images by Section

#### Hero Section:
**Search:** "medical legal consultation" or "attorney doctor meeting"
- Show attorney and medical professional reviewing documents together
- Modern, professional setting
- Conveys partnership and trust

#### Step 1: Profile Setup
**Search:** "professional dashboard" or "user profile setup"
- Clean modern interface on screen
- Professional workspace
- Conveys ease of use and organization

#### Step 2: Find Specialist
**Search:** "search directory" or "medical provider search"
- Person using search/filter interface
- Directory of professionals
- Conveys discoverability and choice

#### Step 3: Coordinate Cases
**Search:** "case coordination" or "team collaboration"
- Multiple professionals working together
- Calendar/scheduling visual
- Documents being reviewed
- Conveys efficiency and organization

#### For Attorneys:
**Search:** "attorney medical records" or "lawyer consultation"
- Attorney reviewing medical documents
- Professional law office setting
- Conveys expertise and thoroughness

#### For Providers:
**Search:** "doctor professional" or "medical provider consultation"
- Medical professional in modern setting
- Reviewing patient information
- Professional and approachable

## Image Specifications

### Technical Requirements:
- **Format:** JPEG or WebP for web optimization
- **Resolution:** Minimum 1200px width for hero, 600px for others
- **Aspect Ratio:** 
  - Hero: 16:9 or wider landscape
  - Steps: 3:2 landscape (h-48 = 192px height)
  - For Attorneys/Providers: 4:3 or 3:2 (h-80 = 320px height)
- **Compression:** Use ?auto=compress&cs=tinysrgb&w=1200 for large, &w=600 for smaller
- **File Size:** Optimize for web (< 200KB per image)

### Content Requirements:
- Professional, not stock-looking
- Diverse representation (gender, ethnicity, age)
- Modern, clean aesthetic
- Matches MedNexus brand colors (blue, teal, green tones)
- No branded/copyrighted materials visible
- Appropriate rights/licenses for commercial use

## Implementation Checklist

### Phase 1: Image Research
- [ ] Search Unsplash for hero image (medical-legal partnership)
- [ ] Search for Step 1 image (professional dashboard/setup)
- [ ] Search for Step 2 image (search/discovery)
- [ ] Search for Step 3 image (coordination/collaboration)
- [ ] Search for Attorney section image
- [ ] Search for Provider section image

### Phase 2: Image Selection
- [ ] Download and review all images
- [ ] Check image licenses (Unsplash License = free for commercial)
- [ ] Verify image quality and resolution
- [ ] Test images for color compatibility with brand

### Phase 3: Optimization
- [ ] Compress images for web (TinyPNG or similar)
- [ ] Host on CDN or use Unsplash/Pexels CDN URLs
- [ ] Generate WebP versions if hosting locally
- [ ] Test loading performance

### Phase 4: Implementation
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 144 (Hero image)
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 203 (Step 1)
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 222 (Step 2)
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 241 (Step 3)
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 266 (Attorneys)
- [ ] Update client/pages/Index.tsx line 346 (Providers)
- [ ] Update alt text to accurately describe new images
- [ ] Test responsive behavior on mobile/tablet/desktop

### Phase 5: Quality Assurance
- [ ] Visual review on all screen sizes
- [ ] Check image loading performance
- [ ] Verify alt text is descriptive and accurate
- [ ] Ensure images align with brand message
- [ ] Get stakeholder approval

## Alt Text Best Practices

Update alt text to be:
- Descriptive of actual image content
- Include keywords naturally (medical, legal, coordination)
- Keep under 125 characters
- Don''t start with "Image of" or "Picture of"

**Examples:**
- âŒ "Professional handshake between attorneys and medical providers"
- âœ… "Attorney and physician reviewing medical case files together in modern office"

## Expected Outcomes

### Visual Impact:
- More professional, polished appearance
- Better trust signals for B2B audience
- Clearer representation of platform functionality
- Stronger brand alignment

### User Experience:
- Improved comprehension of platform features
- Better visual storytelling
- Faster recognition of user benefits
- Increased conversion potential

## Branch
`feature/upgrade-homepage-images`

## Type
Design improvement / Content update

## Priority
Medium

## Related
- Homepage design
- Brand trust signals
- User experience optimization
EOF

Bash(/c/Program Files/GitHub CLI/gh.exe issue create --title "Simplify homepage pricing preview section" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Issue
The current pricing preview section on the homepage mixes attorney and provider plans in a confusing way, with a ""Most Popular"" badge that doesn''t make sense when comparing across different user types.

**Current layout:**
- 3 columns: Attorney Starter ($99) | Provider Practice ($49, ""Most Popular"") | Enterprise (Custom)
- Confusing because ""Most Popular"" compares attorney vs provider plans (apples to oranges)
- Layout feels cluttered with too much information

## Proposed Solution
Simplify to a two-column layout that clearly separates user types:

**New layout:**
- 2 columns: ""For Attorneys"" | ""For Providers""
- Each column shows ""Plans starting at"" with the base price
- Briefcase icon for attorneys (legal-gold color)
- Stethoscope icon for providers (medical-teal color)
- Links direct to pricing page with type parameter (?type=attorney or ?type=provider)
- No ""Most Popular"" badge (avoids comparing different user types)

## Benefits
- Clearer user type differentiation
- No confusing cross-user-type comparisons
- Simpler, more focused message
- Better mobile responsive layout
- Reduces cognitive load for users

## Implementation Details

### Files to Modify (1):
- `client/pages/Index.tsx` - Update pricing preview section (lines 515-632)

### Changes:
1. Change from 3-column to 2-column grid (`md:grid-cols-2` instead of `md:grid-cols-3`)
2. Remove ""Most Popular"" badge
3. Add user type icons (Briefcase, Stethoscope)
4. Simplify to ""Plans starting at $99"" / ""Plans starting at Free""
5. Show 3 key benefits per user type instead of specific plan details
6. Update CTAs to include query parameters: `/pricing?type=attorney` and `/pricing?type=provider`
7. Update footer text to emphasize trial

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Two-column layout on desktop
- [ ] Single column stack on mobile
- [ ] Briefcase icon for attorneys (legal-gold color)
- [ ] Stethoscope icon for providers (medical-teal color)
- [ ] ""Plans starting at $99"" for attorneys
- [ ] ""Plans starting at Free"" for providers
- [ ] No ""Most Popular"" badge
- [ ] 3 benefits listed per user type
- [ ] CTAs link to `/pricing?type=attorney` and `/pricing?type=provider`
- [ ] Footer mentions HIPAA compliance and 14-day free trial
- [ ] Responsive design works correctly
- [ ] No console errors

## Branch
`feature/simplify-pricing-preview`

## Type
Design improvement / UX enhancement

## Priority
Medium
EOF

Bash("/c/Program Files/GitHub CLI/gh.exe" pr create --title "fix: Update hero gradient to use CSS variables for dark mode" --body "$(cat <<''EOF''
## Issue
The homepage hero section (with the handshake image) was still using hardcoded gradient colors that didn''t respond to dark mode:
```tsx
bg-gradient-to-br from-white via-white to-light-gray
```

This caused the hero section to remain white even when dark mode was enabled.

## Root Cause
The sed bulk replacement in Phase 2 only targeted standalone color classes like `bg-white` and `bg-light-gray`, but didn''t catch gradient syntax like `from-white`, `via-white`, and `to-light-gray`.

## Solution
Updated the hero section gradient to use CSS variables:
```tsx
// Before
bg-gradient-to-br from-white via-white to-light-gray

// After
bg-gradient-to-br from-background via-background to-muted
```

## Changes
- **File:** `client/pages/Index.tsx` (line 106)
- **Change:** 1 line updated
- Gradient now uses semantic CSS variables that respond to theme

## Testing
âœ… Hero section now changes color when theme toggle is clicked
âœ… Light mode: White to light gray gradient (unchanged visually)
âœ… Dark mode: Dark background gradient
âœ… No other visual regressions
âœ… Dev server compiles without errors

## Type of Change
- [x] Bug fix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature
- [ ] Breaking change
- [ ] Documentation update

## Related
- Missed in PR #34 (Phase 2 dark mode migration)
- Discovered during post-merge visual QA

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)
EOF
)" --base main)

## Issue
Several gray color classes on the homepage were missed in the Phase 2 bulk replacement and weren''t responding to dark mode:

- CTA subtext and trust bar: `text-gray-600`
- Stats section labels: `text-gray-300`
- Stat dividers: `border-gray-600`
- Testimonial indicators: `bg-gray-300`
- FAQ hover: `hover:bg-gray-100`

## Root Cause
These specific gray shade variants (`text-gray-600`, `text-gray-300`, `border-gray-600`) were not included in the Phase 2 sed replacement pattern, which only targeted `text-gray-400` and `bg-gray-50`.

## Solution
Replace all remaining gray colors with CSS variables:

### Changes Made:
- `text-gray-600` â†’ `text-muted-foreground` (CTA subtext, trust bar)
- `text-gray-300` â†’ `text-muted-foreground` (stats section labels)
- `border-gray-600` â†’ `border-muted-foreground` (stat dividers)
- `bg-gray-300` â†’ `bg-muted` (testimonial indicators)
- `hover:bg-gray-100` â†’ `hover:bg-accent` (FAQ accordion hover)

## Affected Areas:
1. **Hero CTA** - "No credit card required" text
2. **Trust Bar** - Trust signal text
3. **Stats Section** - Label text and divider borders on navy background
4. **Testimonials** - Carousel indicator dots
5. **FAQ** - Accordion item hover state
